Class Water

java.lang.Object
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.PhysicalPropertyMethod
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.liquidphysicalproperties.LiquidPhysicalPropertyMethod
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.liquidphysicalproperties.viscosity.Viscosity
neqsim.physicalproperties.methods.liquidphysicalproperties.viscosity.Water
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, ViscosityInterface, PhysicalPropertyMethodInterface
public class Water extends Viscosity
Salt-water viscosity using Laliberté (2007) with erratum coefficients.

Mixture rule (weight fractions): η_m = η_w^{w_w} Π η_i^{w_i}, where η_w is the pure-water viscosity (from NeqSim's water correlation) and η_i are "solute viscosities" from Laliberté: 

(η_i / mPa·s) = exp( [ν1 (1 - w_w)^{ν2} + ν3] / [ν4 (t/°C) + 1] )
                / ( ν5 (1 - w_w)^{ν6} + 1 )
with w_w = mass fraction of water in the liquid phase.

Supported salts (coefficients ν1–ν6): NaCl, KCl, KCOOH (potassium formate), NaBr, CaCl2, KBr. If a salt is not recognized, NaCl coefficients are used, as suggested in the supplementary info to the paper. References: - G. Laliberté, Ind. Eng. Chem. Res., 2007, 46, 8865–8872 (+ erratum).

Author:
Even Solbraa
